channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 59 dead and more than 150 injured in nightclub fire in North Macedonia
item.description: A massive nightclub fire killed 59 people early Sunday in North Macedonia 's eastern town of Kocani, and injured more than 150. The blaze broke out during a concert by a local pop group.
item.content:encoded:
A massive nightclub fire killed 59 people early Sunday in North Macedonia 's eastern town of Kocani, and injured more than 150. The blaze broke out during a concert by a local pop group.

(Image credit: Boris Grdanoski)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Forget about rare earth minerals. We need more copper
item.description: In recent weeks, you've likely heard a lot about rare-earth substances with hard-to-pronounce names, but experts warn that the shortage of another crucial metal, copper, could be just as concerning.
item.content:encoded:
In recent weeks, you've likely heard a lot about rare-earth substances with hard-to-pronounce names, but experts warn that the shortage of another crucial metal, copper, could be just as concerning.

(Image credit: Glenn Arcos)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: March Madness begins for NPR's College Podcast Challenge
item.description: Our 10 finalists for the best college podcasts in the country include students from some familiar schools, and a few surprises.
item.content:encoded: Our 10 finalists for the best college podcasts in the country include students from some familiar schools, and a few surprises.
item.dc:creator: Steve Drummond

item.title: NASA's stuck astronauts welcome their newly arrived replacements to the space station
item.description: Just over a day after blasting off, a SpaceX crew capsule arrived at the International Space Station on Sunday, delivering the replacements for NASA's two stuck astronauts.
item.content:encoded:
Just over a day after blasting off, a SpaceX crew capsule arrived at the International Space Station on Sunday, delivering the replacements for NASA's two stuck astronauts.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Federal judge blocks Trump's plan to target 'alien enemies' for deportation
item.description: Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.
item.content:encoded:
Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Trump orders strikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen and issues new warning
item.description: Trump said the U.S. would use "overwhelming lethal force" until Iranian-backed Houthi rebels cease their attacks on shipping. The Houthis said nine civilians were killed.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said the U.S. would use "overwhelming lethal force" until Iranian-backed Houthi rebels cease their attacks on shipping. The Houthis said nine civilians were killed.

(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump Administration say South Africa's Ambassador to U.S. 'persona non grata'
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says he's kicking out the Ambassador from South Africa -accusing him of hating America and hating Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio says he's kicking out the Ambassador from South Africa -accusing him of hating America and hating Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Cliff Owen)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: 'Bloody Saturday' at Voice of America and other U.S.-funded networks
item.description: Federal officials placed 1,300 employees at Voice of America on indefinite paid leave, while severing contracts with Radio Free Asia and other U.S.-funded networks.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials placed 1,300 employees at Voice of America on indefinite paid leave, while severing contracts with Radio Free Asia and other U.S.-funded networks.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill 9, including aid workers and journalists
item.description: Two back-to-back Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza killed at least nine people on Saturday, according to Gaza civil defense. Witnesses say several of those killed were aid workers and journalists.
item.content:encoded:
Two back-to-back Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza killed at least nine people on Saturday, according to Gaza civil defense. Witnesses say several of those killed were aid workers and journalists.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.description: Here are the winning entries in this year's Global Ability Photography Challenge.
item.content:encoded: Here are the winning entries in this year's Global Ability Photography Challenge.
